title: Notes by the Way; or, what I saw in my rambles
author: Higginson, H. Talbot.
snippet: On emergingfrom the train you will be surrounded with hotel porters, omnibus drivers,and touters from all the different hotels; so that if you have not madeup your mind beforehand which hotel you intend staying at, you will berather confused. The Railway Hotel is a very fair one, and close athand. It was there I stayed the first time I visited Killarney, but Ifound it rather expensive and not very comfortable, as it was too public.

title: Our old home, and English note-books;
author: Hawthorne, Nathaniel
snippet: in about an hour and a quarter, and have put up at the Railway Hotel. After dinner we walked into the town to see
